org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies

Class FXRotateSelectedOnRotatePolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.policies.AbstractPolicy<VR>
      • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.policies.AbstractInteractionPolicy<javafx.scene.Node>
        • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies.AbstractFXInteractionPolicy
          • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.fx.policies.FXRotateSelectedOnRotatePolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAdaptable.Bound<IVisualPart<javafx.scene.Node,? extends javafx.scene.Node>>, IFXOnRotatePolicy, IPolicy<javafx.scene.Node>

    public class FXRotateSelectedOnRotatePolicy
extends AbstractFXInteractionPolicy
implements IFXOnRotatePolicy
    The FXRotateSelectedOnRotatePolicy is an IFXOnRotatePolicy that rotates the whole selection when its host experiences a touch rotate gesture.

      • determineTargetParts

        protected java.util.List<IContentPart<javafx.scene.Node,? extends javafx.scene.Node>> determineTargetParts()
        Returns a List containing all IContentParts that should be rotated by this policy. Per default, the whole selection is returned.
        Returns:
        A List containing all IContentParts that should be rotated by this policy.

        Returns the FXTransformPolicy that is installed on the given IVisualPart.

      • isRotate

        protected boolean isRotate(javafx.scene.input.RotateEvent event)
        Returns true if the given RotateEvent should trigger rotation. Otherwise returns false. Per default always returns true.
        Parameters:
        event - The RotateEvent in question.
        Returns:
        true to indicate that the given RotateEvent should trigger rotation, otherwise false.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(javafx.scene.input.RotateEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: IFXOnRotatePolicy
        Continuous reaction to rotation gestures. Called continuously on finger movement, after the gesture has been started, and before it has been finished.
        Specified by:
        rotate in interface IFXOnRotatePolicy
        Parameters:
        e - The original RotateEvent.
